Live Blog | U of L-UK football updates

The Cards and Cats kick at noon inside Papa John's Cardinal Stadium.

Everything you need to get ready for U of L-UK

Live Blog | U of L-UK football updates

Jonathan Lintner, jlintner@courier-journal.com 11:30 a.m. EST November 29, 2014
Buy Photo

U of L and UK players pushed and shoved twice before Saturday's game at Papa John's Cardinal Stadium.(Photo: By Scott Utterback/The Courier-Journal)Buy Photo

CONNECT 8 TWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

Refresh this page (or click here) for updates from Papa John's Cardinal Stadium as the University of Louisville hosts Kentucky's football team at noon Saturday.

The first late-season U of L-UK game is finally here, though the Cards and Cats didn't get to kickoff without more than one scuffle at midfield.

Shortly after U of L players came out for warmups, plenty of jawing, pushing and shoving broke out on the Cardinal logo at midfield.

Who started it? Who knows.

Afterward, more UK players came on the field, running past U of L's, who were warming up. It started again. This one was bigger, and it all happened on the Cards' side of the 50-yard line.

Who started it? Count the Cats as the instigators.

Officials will look this sort of thing over and deem before kickoff it it merits penalties or ejections. Since the second get-together, referees and security are separating the two sides at midfield.

L's are thrown by a Kentucky player as he taunts Louisville players. #bbn#l1c4pic.twitter.com/jPL9SLZ4u6

— Matt Stone (@mattstonephotog) November 29, 2014

• It's an otherwise dreary day at Cardinal Stadium, where it's so overcast that lights are on for a noon kickoff. But temperatures are mild and could climb above 50 degrees.

• Before their first noon kickoff of the year, the Cards will send off seniors with an 11:30 a.m. ceremony. We'll be sure to include photos from what's always an emotional moment.

• Some local connections: There are seven Trinity and five St. Xavier alumni on rosters today, along with two from Christian Academy. Additionally, U of L's Dominique Brown and UK's Mike Edwards attended the same Ohio high school, as did the Cards' James Hearns and Cats' Kendall Randolph in Florida. Additionally, Kelby Johnson and Cory Johnson both attended ASA College in New York.

• As for jersey combinations, UK has white tops and helmets to go with blue bottoms. U of L hasn't appeared on the field in uniform as of 11 a.m., though the school advertised this game as a "Red Out."

• We'll do some score watching for you too, Cards fans. Of interest to U of L and Orange Bowl reps are another pair of noon matchups -- South Carolina at Clemson and Georgia Tech at Georgia -- as well as Florida at Florida State at 3:30 p.m. The Cards need Clemson and Georgia Tech losses today paired with an FSU victory over the Gators as well as the Yellow Jackets in the ACC championship.

• For more, check out a post linking all our Courier-Journal U of L-UK coverage (http://cjky.it/1HM0RKu) and follow our team of reporters and columnists tweeting from the stadium: @KyleTucker_CJ, @jeffgreer_cj, @adamhimmelsbach, @TimSullivan714, @SteveJones_CJ and @JonathanLintner.
